result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron H Ortiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Aaron H Ortiz
Current: 571 Cty Rd A, c/o Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States  (Effective: 02-24-2016)
Prior: 322 S Brooklyn St, Berlin, WI 54923
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 03-01-2016 01:00 pm

No Contact provision of bond has been cancelled.
43

2:36 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Sara Kneevers.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Kneevers - defendant will represent himself on 2015CM42.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Atty Kneevers recites agreement - defendant will plea to counts 1 & 2 on 2014CM182 and court 1 on 2015CM42 with no repeater.  2014CM183 and count 2 on 2015CM42 will be dismissed and read-in.  ADA concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to counts 1 & 2 as charged on 2014CM182 and count 1 with no repeater on 2015CM42.  Court orders 2014CM183 and count 2 on 2015CM42 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Kneevers.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2014CM182 (counts 1 & 2)

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS:

court costs
AODA
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
Count 1 - 20 days county jail, stayed and is to be used by the Agent for disciplinary purposes.


2015CM42 (count 1)

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS:

court costs
AODA
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Court adjourned at 2:48 p.m.

1:59 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Sara Kneevers present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions Atty regarding counsel on 2015CM42.  Statement by Atty Kneevers - has not been appointed as of yet, but resolution resolves all cases.  Court will set for plea & sentencing - defendant must appear or warrant will be issued.  Court sets on May 5, 2015 at 2:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:00 p.m.

11:32 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Atty Sara Kneevers present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - Atty Kneevers does not represent on 2015CM32 but has informed the defendant that he will need to reapply to the PD's office for representation on the new case.  Court will set for Plea & Sentencing in approx 30 days.  

Court adjourned at 11:33 a.m.
